“Today oil – tomorrow new Saddam” – this the shortest
 way to describe situation in Azerbaijan and
 relationship of the West toward it. 
 I won’t be mistaken if I say that the oil is biggest
 curve that any small country may have. I wish we never
 had it. Since humanity understood a value of it our
 land do NOT belong to us. Things which were during
 USSR or even before might be explained by the
 communism and the fight against it, by poor
 understanding of meaning of democracy all over the
 world and so on. But what is happening now?
 Do you know it? Do you want to know it? 
 Prioritets of the policy of current US administration
 is oil itself. I don’t know what is going on in Iraq
 or other Arabic countries. In Azerbaijan the democracy
 is betreaten. And that’s it !!! People say now: the
 smell of the oil kills the taste of democracy. They
 are not far from truth. 
 Azerbaijan was one of the first to strike against the
 soviet empire and for democracy. We had more dead and
 injured on this way that any other republic in the
 USSR had. We got it. It lasted only 2 years. Then oil
 issue begun. 
 Last president election was a reanimation of monarchy
 in the first democratic republic in Islam world (1918-1920). 
 Ofcourse this process was masked by PSEUDOelection. The
 international rules want our government to show the
 great theatre called “president election”. And they
 did it. The world kept silence, only few statements we
 heart. Someone can say: what we can do? Azerbaijan is
 independent republic. The statement is only way to
 influence situation. It could be right we one spoke
 about Saddam, he did not obey anyone in this world.
 Ours do obey yet. Yet. And they obey not to statement.
 Statements are for you and me – common citizens. If
 the West really wanted them to do well they would,
 they possibly could not “say NO”. Until main interest
 of official West is oil, not people, human rights and
 democracy. Therefore official West keeps dealing with
 these local dictators. And it will do it until people
 will get disappointed, and lose faith in West values
 of freedom and turn to crazy Islamic leaders. They
 will fall into another dictatorship. More dangerous
 and ambitious one. And the world will get brand new
 Saddam or Khomeni. 
 Official West will not change it policy until the
 electorate changes. You can make them change policy.
 Not we. We will fight for our rights but our fight is
 endless as long as the West supporting our government
 (see Georgia – former president resigned as he lost
 support of the West). So would did our “president”. He
 would if had no support. But he had and happened most
 cruel repressions since our independence. 
 The question is: is few statements (even objective and
 straight) all the international society can do? Just
 to make local dictators to be directors of such
 theaters and carnivals? And the people is just casting
 in these plays? 
 You are electing your government, which, in turn,
 governs ours. We don’t select no one of them.
 Therefore only you, common elector, can help such
 countries as Azerbaijan and prevent a transformation
 of the small European country (though it
 geographically far from Europe) into classical Asian
 dictatorship (though it geographically is not Asia
 either). 
 Best regards,

Ive read a couple of your previous posts.
 
 Now i cant believe that what you say is happenning, if its as bad as you say surely somebody would have reported it.

Human Rights Watch posted about Azerbaijan elections! 
 Please read! 
 http://hrw.org/reports/2004/azerbaijan0104/
The only thing you all can do is to do what Georgia did.

The only thing you all can do is to do what Georgia did.

 Easy to say, Georgia did it with USA support...

Not really. The people had already done it and we said we were glad to see it happen...
 
 You all have to organize. You have to demonstrate in the masses and you must cry out to the international community. I'd be writing letters to every organization and news entity you know of...

Not really. The people had already done it and we said we were glad to see it happen...
 
 You all have to organize. You have to demonstrate in the masses and you must cry out to the international community. I'd be writing letters to every organization and news entity you know of...

 I think we gave the Georgians a boost and we're continuing to fund and train them. We really helped out the Georgians a lot, I think.
 We've donated one-billion dollars, approximately, in the past twelve-years for something veritable. It's projected to be another $166-million in this upcoming year. Id like to think we helped the Georgians to an extent at least. :(
